column1: pitched up and angling across off, 124ks, Elgar simply ushers it through to the keeper
Lakmal hikes up his pace to 132ks and finds inswing. Back of a length and swerves back in to cramp Elgar for room. He manages to fend it away to the leg side
shorter than the previous delivery and swings back in once again, Elgar jams an inside edge to deep fine leg
fuller than a good length, angling in at off, then swinging away against the angle. Markram presses forward and pats it down
back of a length and angling into middle and leg, 134ks, Markram shuffles across off and defensively works the ball away to the midwicket region
starts outside off and moves further away, Markram has nothing to do with that
full and largely holds its line outside off, left alone
nice and full outside off, ignored once again by Elgar
back of a length and Vishwa explores the channel outside off again, Elgar, however, doesn't
dangled up outside off, and nips away, finishes on a set of stumps outside off, Elgar thought about having a crack at it. He lets it go in the end
pitched up and curls away outside off, no shot offered
on a length and closer to off, Vishwa cranks up to 141ks, ignored
good length and on a fourth-stump line, no movement either way. Markram stretches out and blocks stoutly
back of a length and shoved down the leg side, away from the reach of Markram's flick
short and angling into the middle of Markram's back-foot defence
full and zipping through outside off, Markram standing on off, lets it go in the channel
much fuller and attacking the stumps, Markram presses forward and taps the ball only as far as mid-on
fuller and angling into off, excellent lines and lengths with the new ball from SL, Markram shuffles across off and defends to the leg side
full and swinging into the pads of Elgar, nudged away to fine leg for one
full and attacking the pads, 141ks dart from Vishwa, clipped away through square leg
too full and on the pads, Markram helps himself with a delectable on-drive. Picked away with the swing to the right of mid-on
full and on off and middle, whisked away to short midwicket off the front foot
short and just a shade outside off, Markram hangs back and jabs to mid-off

Vishwa draws an appeal for lbw. Umpire Dar doesn't budge, but Dimuth then calls for a review. Nice and full, swings back in to have Markram falling over and playing around his front pad. Strikes the front pad below the knee-roll. Was it missing leg stump? Oh okay, it pitched outside leg and SL lost a review
Lakmal hits an in-between length and gets the ball to seam back in sharply now. Cramps Markram for room and pings the thigh pad. It was surely bouncing over the stumps
on a length and outside off, Markram shoulders arms
perfectly pitched ball on off. Defended back to the bowler. SL's new-ball bowlers showing great discipline
shortish and outside off, Markram stands up tall and fends the ball to the leg side

that's a cracker from Lakmal. How did that miss the edge? That's the teasing thought in Lakmal's head as he walks back. On a length, angling in, tricks the batsman into playing for the angle, then jags away past the outside edge
strays on the hips, picked off behind square on the leg side for the double
too full and too straight, Elgar stretches out and puts it away to the midwicket boundary with a wristy flick
full and holds its line outside off, run away to backward point

Vishwa breaches the defences of Elgar, who is stunned. Vishwa ventures wide of the crease. After getting a few balls to swing away outside off, he gets this one to zip back in sharply and barge through Elgar's castle. Vishwa knocks over Elgar and the off stump. Elgar can't believe what has just happened

Vishwa now storms through the defences of Amla. Catch him if you can. He sets off on a celebratory sprint. Pitched further up and swings back in against the angle from over the wicket. Amla doesn't quite cover for the movement and the middle stump takes a beating
Vishwa nearly has Bavuma chopping on. Catches him in the crease, inside-edged onto the ground, the ball bounces over off stump
back of a length and zipping away outside off. WHAT.AN.OVER, Vishwa
on a length and outside off, driven on the up to short cover
back of a length and slanted back in, pings the thigh pad

Scenes in PE! What have you done, Bavuma? He falls for a duck too. This was full on middle and leg, Markram simply drives it straight to mid-on. Bavuma, though, ventures a single. It just wasn't there. There was no call from Markram either. Rajitha swoops down on the ball and nails the stumps at the non-striker's end to catch Bavuma miles short
pitched up and wide outside off, Markram chases a drive and scoops it away to backward point
full and homing in at off, dabbed to short cover
on a length and outside off, du Plessis loosens his grip and fends it gently to the cordon
back of a length and outside off, blocked back down the pitch
dug in short and angling across off, Markram gets on top of the ball and fends it back
short and Vishwa hits the bat hard as opposed to bat hitting ball. Markram jabs it towards the cordon
really full on the pads, chipped to one of the two short midwickets on the leg side
glanced off the pads to fine leg for a double
swinging late into the pads, tucked away to fine leg once again
pitched up on middle, Markram holds his shape and drives it ram-rod straight down the ground
fuller on off, driven up to short cover
on a length and just a shade outside off, patted back down the pitch
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, defended back to the bowler
back of a length and running away outside off, ignored. Encouraging carry to the keeper
fuller and outside off, Markram closes the bat-face and miscues a drive to mid-on
dug in short on middle, fended back down the pitch
back of a length and slanting away outside off, no shot
banged in short and attacking the stumps, kept out
Lakmal throws himself to his left from mid-off and stops this firm front-foot drive from du Plessis
back of a length and outside off, no shot
back of a length on the hips, deflected away to fine leg
fullish and outside off, du Plessis opens the face and knocks the ball to cover
short and rises outside off, du Plessis rises on top of it and diffuses it to cover
pitched up on off, tapped away past the left of the bowler
banged in short and outside off, fended back to the bowler
on a length and kicks up at off, 130ks, it looked a lot quicker than that. Faf yanks his bottom hand off the bat and fends it off with the top hand
full and angling in at off stump, du Plessis bunts a single to the right of mid-on
Vishwa hits the deck hard and smacks Faf on the glove. The ball rolls away to the leg side
back of a length and on the hips, Markram turns a single away to the leg side
on a length, starts on off stump and swerves away at 137ks, du Plessis jabs a single to the covers
banged in short and angling across off, Markram gets on top of the bounce and punches up to cover
dug in short again, du Plessis ducks under it
short and hits the splice, fended back to the bowler on middle
back of a length and outside off, Markram gets right behind the line and blocks the ball to cover
full and angling into middle, driven to mid-on off the front foot
Markram gets on top of a short ball outside off and strongly punches it through extra-cover. Laced away to the boundary
on a length and outside off, Markram tips forward and pats it to cover
on a length and outside off, ignored
wide of the crease, but this length ball holds its line outside off, no shot
angled across him, on a length, and he goes back to defend
fuller, straighter, and he stretches forward to defend. This was bowled at 135kph
length, at 133kph, and he goes back and defends it straight down the pitch
shorter, and jabs at him from a length, bowled at 140kph, and he goes back and defends it towards fine leg
fuller, down leg, and he plays it off his pads towards a man stationed now at short midwicket
short, down leg side, and he is able to adjust and play it away towards square leg
full, straight, 135kph, and he presses forward and defends
length, outside off, and he defends from the crease
length ball, outside off, and he presses forward to defend. This came at 125kph

fuller, straighter, and he drives it towards mid on. The fielder there makes the stop, but seems to have done some damage to his fingers. Looks like Lakmal, who had the ball bob up from the grass and strike his left arm
length ball, outside off, swinging away at 136kph, and he leaves it
length, outside off, and he can shoulder arms to it
length, outside off, and he leaves
straighter, on a length, and he can play this 130kph ball comfortably from the crease
fuller, just a little wide of off stump, and he lets it go. A brave leave, this...
straighter, and jabs up from a length again. Not the first time it has happened this morning, but he plays it well, taking his bottom hand off
fuller, outside off, and he comes forward to defend. This was bowled at 134kph
fuller, outside off, and swinging away, and he lets it pass
outside off, and draws him into a drive, just going past his outside edge. Well bowled!
oversteps in an attempt to generate pace. Went fuller, and a bit faster, and got Markram to hurry into a forward defensive
length, outside off, bowled at 137kph, and he leaves
length, just a hint of shape away, and he stretches forward to defend towards covers
length, and he goes back to defend this ball outside off, seaming back into him at 137kph
length, angling into him from wide of the stumps, and he taps it towards short midwicket
outside off, from a length, and he leaves it
length ball, jags into him from a length, and he defends from the crease
jags back from a length, and takes the outside of the pad as it cuts him in half. Hits him very high, though
swings from outside off, further away, and he leaves. This delivered at 131kph
gorgeous on drive! Pitched up, hoping for some swing, but Markram leans into it and just eases it past mid on with the full face of the bat
outside off, and he lets it go as it goes straight on with the angle, delivered from wide of the crease
length, outside off, and he defends this 135kph ball from the crease with the full face of the bat
pitches on leg stump and hits the pad as du Plessis goes back to defend
straighter, and he goes back to defend
fuller, outside off, and he drives it short cover
outside off, and he drives after stretching forward, and short cover cuts it off
fired in shorter, and he goes back and whips it off his pads towards square leg
fuller, outside off, and he drives it back towards the bowler
full, outside off, and he drives it, but cover cuts it off, diving away to his left
fuller, and he drives it past covers, but the man from mid off goes across to his left and cuts it off. Half-stops it, and recovers enough to send it back quickly
straighter, and a bit slower, and he allows it to come to him before nurdling it away towards midwicket
straighter, fuller, and he drives it straight back down the wicket. This was delivered at 130kph
length, outside off, swinging away, and he lets it pass
length ball, and he presses forward to defend it, just outside off
presses forward and drives it towards mid off and picks up a single
tossed up, around leg stump, and he defends. That was just 74kph!
flighted again on leg stump, and he presses forward and defends
shorter, and he can go back and push it towards covers with the turn away from him
tossed up, and he biffs it through covers. The shot was out there for the taking, and he executed it very well
tossed up, and he drives it back down the stumps. Embuldeniya gets a hand to it, but cannot prevent a single
length, outside off, and he lets it go
length, but strays down the pads, and he can flick it towards square leg
length, outside off, and he stretches and then shoulders arms
length, outside off, 131kph, and he defends after getting up on his toes
short, and he goes back and steers it towards long leg with a roll of the wrists
short, outside off, and he goes back and whips it towards short midwicket
tossed up, and a bit of turn, takes the outside of du Plessis' bat, but eludes first slip on its way down to third man

uses his feet to come down the track to a length ball, and drives it back down the wicket. It strikes the stumps, and there's a polite appeal for a runout, but the bowler had failed to beat Markram's stretch back into the crease
defends off the front foot
comes forward and drives a length ball with the turn towards cover
shorter, and he goes back and punches it to the left of cover. Beautiful shot!
presses forward to defend a length ball tossed up on off stump
banged in short, and it sticks in the surface a bit. The batsman is up on his toes, looking to drive it, and it almost carries back to the bowler
outside off, moving away, 137kph, and he leaves
short, outside off, and he gets up on his toes and punches it towards cover
length ball, outside off, and jags away off the seam, and he leaves
fuller, straighter, and he defends
fuller, and he drives it on the up, but into the gap between cover and mid off. It pulls up before the extra cover boundary
tossed up, straight, and he presses forward to defend
fuller, outside off, and he opts to push himself all the way back in the crease and punch it towards covers
outside off, and he goes back to punch it towards short cover
presses forward and defends a length ball on off stump
tossed up, quicker in the air at 96kph, and turns sharply, but he can go back and punch it towards covers
turns, and goes wide for the batsman, and he leans back and smacks it to the left of cover. Good shot!
fuller, outside off, and he drives it towards mid off
banged in short, outside off, and he looks to hook, but misses the ball by a fair distance
outside off, and he leaves it
full, but down the leg side, and he can glance this down, fine enough to beat the man at long leg
outside off, and he lets it pass as it moves away from him at 135kph
length, outside off, and he comes forward to defend
length, and he defends
length, outside off, and he leaves it
length, and he goes back to defend
presses forward to defend a length ball

WHAT A TWIST! Pitched full up, and du Plessis just missed that completely. Karunaratne jumps up and down, like someone who just won the lottery. It's a good ball, though...pitched right up, and crept under his blade as he looked to drive it straight back down the ground. That's just Karunaratne's second ever Test wicket, and what a time to do it!
floated up on off stump, played back to Dimuth to round out a wicket-maiden
fuller and angling across off, blocked to the leg side
picked away behind square on the leg side
lifter outside off, de Kock ignores it
pitched further up and outside off, ignored
short and wide outside off, de Kock reaches out for the ball and slashes a cut to the off-side sweeper
back of a length and attacking middle stump, Markram jumps across off and resolutely blocks to midwicket
little legroller on middle, 105ks, patted back to the bowler
dropped short and wide outside off, loose ball, de Kock goes deep in the crease and slaps it away behind point for four
really full, swings and dips at off, the sort of ball that crept under the defences of Faf. De Kock jams it out
good length on off, played back down the pitch
shortish and cramps the batsman for room, chopped from off stump to fine gully
full and swings into the pads as de Kock falls over the flick and does not make contact with the bat
wide of the crease, back of a length and outside off, cracked to extra-cover off the front foot
overpitched and outside off, Vishwa errs and de Kock latches onto it, leaning into a drive and sending the ball purring through extra-cover
dug in short and outside off, skids on and de Kock drags a pull only as far as midwicket
really full and just a shade outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
on a length and finishes wide - wider than a set of stumps outside off - de Kock ignores it. Replays suggest that was the cross-seamer from Vishwa
banged in short and outside off, de Kock camps back, rides the bounce and plays to point
full and outside off, Markram gets forward and winds up scooping a drive to cover
Dimuth pulls his length back, worked off the pads to midwicket
looks like another legroller outside off, Markram is so strong off the back foot. He jumps back and punches with a high elbow through the covers. Delightful timing
on the pads, tucked away to Vishwa at long leg
fuller and on off, blocked back to Dimuth off the front foot
shorter and wider outside off, Markram lets it go
banged in short and outside off, de Kock swerves out of the way and lets it go
another lifter outside off, de Kock shelves the hook and lets it go once again
short and wide, not as short as the previous two balls, de Kock camps back and square-cuts it away for a double
really full on off, driven only as far as mid-on
Markram shimmies out to meet a full ball outside off early. He opens the face and drives it languidly to the right of point. Boom
back of a length and angling into a leg-side flick between deep square and long leg
nice and full, angling in, then snaking away as Markram plays inside the line for the angle. Beaten
full on the stumps, driven down to long-on
on a length and angling into a gentle tickle to the leg side. Markram brings up his sixth 6th Test fifty. A hug with de Kock is part of the celebrations at PE
De Kock leans back to a short ball outside off and chops it down to square third man for a single
looks like another legroller, finishes just a shade outside off, blocked back to Dimuth
pitched up on off, forward and driven down to mid-on
on a length and outside off, driven on the up to the right of short cover. Dhananjaya throws himself to his right to take some pace off the ball
back of a length and skids onto Markram, gathers more pace off the pitch, jabbed to cover
on a length and outside off, punchily driven away to the right of sweeper, where Rajitha, I think, fumbles in the deep
short and skids back in at off, cramps the batsman for room, Markram diffuses it
slower bouncer outside off? Markram flaps a pull to long leg
full and outside off, driven through the line to the right of mid-off
short and wide outside off, loose ball from Rajitha, de Kock crunches a cut through cover-point
pitched up and outside off, shovelled away in the air but to the right of mid-on for four
back of a length and angling in at off, played back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, de Kock likes width, he lunges and belts it away between extra-cover and mid-off
short and ducking in at off, punched through the off side. Rajitha has overstepped
Markram closes his bat-face and turns a length ball angling in to midwicket
prodded to cover. 14 runs off the over
back of a length on off, de Kock presses forward and blocks it back to the bowler
short and just a shade outside off, run away through point off the outside half
short and wide outside off, rare loose ball from Fernando, scythed away behind point to the third-man fence
on the hips, punched through midwicket
good length and angling in from round the wicket, tapped back to the left of Vishwa
full and angling in at off, jabbed off the inside half to mid-on
full and on off, this non-turner is defended off the front foot
on a length and just a shade outside off, punched away to the right of short cover
good length and breaks in, nudged with the spin through square leg
tossed outside off, de Kock stays leg-side of the ball and smears it away through cover-point. Pinged off the middle of the bat
looped up on middle, de Kock lunges and plays back to the bowler
dipping full-toss on middle, stabbed back to Dhananjaya
back of a length and speared outside off, Markram does not bother with it

Rajitha provides SL with the breakthrough. Okay, wait, Markram chats with de Kock and opts to challenge the on-field out decision from umpire Dar. Length ball, nips back in, beats the inside edge and crashes into the back pad just above the knee-roll. No bat, but height may be the issue. The tracker returns umpire's call on off stump. That's a bail-trimmer, but enough to send Markram back
Rajitha welcomes him into Test cricket with a short ball outside off, Mulder ignores it
on a length and slanting away outside off, left alone
just short of a length and outside off, delightful back-foot cover-drive from Mulder. What a way to get off the mark in Test cricket
back of a length and outside off, patted to cover
good length and angling into a front-foot defence. Lakmal has overstepped
full on the stumps, de Kock drives sweetly but can't get it past mid-on
straying into the pads, a whirl of the wrists sends the ball away to the midwicket boundary. Shot, Quinton!
back of a length on off, pressed back to the bowler
good length on off, blocked off the front foot to mid-off
pitched up on off, de Kock taps straight of mid-on off the front foot
back of a length on off, de Kock bends forward in defence
whoa! Another rollicking back-foot punch. Fractionally short and outside off, laced away to the cover-point boundary
on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg
whipped away with the wrists to deep square leg for one
full and holds its line outside off, left alone
full and outside off, ignored

Rajitha brings another one back in, this one to Mulder and pins him in front. This looks adjacent and SA decide against a review. On a length and skids back in at off, Mulder falls over and doesn't get his bat in front of the pad
just doesn't carry! Length ball, angled across him, and he edges it, and it almost carries to slip, but just dies on its way down. Might have been well-advised to come forward, but he didn't
drilled down the ground, off a length ball, but fielded by long off
full ball, outside off, and he comes forward to defend. The ball rears up off a length and jams his bottom hand
length, outside off, and he leaves

presses forward and defends a length ball
