length, outside off, and he leaves this
angles in to him, and he taps it towards point
extra effort into this, a fuller ball, but goes down the leg side. A good take by Dickwella, diving away to his right
looks to go full, but ends up overcooking it. De Kock eases it through the onside after taking it on the full
full, outside off, and he walks into it, and drives it through covers. Sweet timing on this occasion. Beats the man at point easily!
length ball, outside off, and he drops it towards covers with soft hands and takes a single

Rajitha is on fire! Good length, and just a bit of movement away, as it draws Maharaj forward to defend. Takes the outside edge, just kissing it along the way, and Dickwella dives forward and completes a smart catch. Now it's a race against time to see if de Kock can counter-attack enough with the three remaining wickets in hand
length ball, and he presses forward and defends
length ball, angles across him, and he comes forward and drives it towards backward point
full ball, across him, and he lets it pass
angles across him from a length, and he defends from the crease
fuller, and straighter, and he gets the inside part of his bat as he defends. The ball goes towards mid on
angles into him, and he comes forward and defends away towards midwicket
angles across him from a good length, and Rabada thinks about poking at it before letting it pass
angles a fuller ball across him, and he lets it pass. This one was delivered at 139kph
angles across him, fuller in length, and he leaves
shorter, straight towards him, and Rabada drops his wrists and lets this pass through to the keeper
fuller, straighter, and he comes forward to defend
length ball, appears to jag back into him, and he is trapped in the crease. They appeal, but then decide against referring this. Might have had an inside edge, or perhaps it pitched just outside leg?
full, angles across him, and he drives it down towards long off
angles into Rabada from around the wicket, and he defends from the crease
length ball, outside off, and he defends from the crease after getting behind the line
fuller ball, and he skews it off the inside edge towards square leg. Didn't know a lot about that ball!
pitched up, and he drives on the up, and it lands just short of Kusal Perera at mid off!
short, and slower than normal at 127kph, and de Kock goes back and then dobs it down towards square leg with soft hands. Played it late, and that allowed him to keep it down
short, outside off, and he is able to ride the bounce and cut it down towards backward point
length ball, just outside off, and beats the outside edge. There's a loud appeal, but they decide against referring this. Beat the outside edge comfortably, according to the replays
fuller, straighter, and he is able to drive this towards long on
full ball, and beats the outside edge again, as Rabada stretches to defend. What a great spell this is from Rajitha! Deception, discipline and energy!
angles across him, on a good length, and he leaves

DROPPED! Got it to straighten after pitching on a good length, and took the outside edge of Rabada as he shaped to drive. It went high towards Dhananjaya de Silva at slip, but he failed to keep it in his hands after initially getting his fingertips to it
short ball, and he goes back and drives it towards covers
short again, and he goes back and forces it towards cover but cannot beat the man there
comes forward and defends a length ball
presses forward and defends a length ball
fuller ball, floated around the leg stump, and he can drive it down to long on
goes back and defends a length ball
length, but wide enough outside off, and he gets up on his toes and cuts it towards backward point
full, outside off, and he forces it away towards cover. There's no fielder inside what would have been the inner ring in white-ball cricket in front of square on the off side
length ball, and he defends from the crease
short, and he ducks inside it
short, but outside off, and he lets it pass
straightens into him from a length, delivered from wide of the crease, and he is rushed into a defensive prod
looks for the yorker, but gets too full. Bowled at 141kph, but Rabada does well to bunt it down towards long on
length ball, and he presses forward to defend
length, outside off, and he presses forward to smother any spin on it
fuller, straighter, and he drives it down to long on
length, and he shortens it further by pressing back, and pushing it towards point
straighter ball, goes on with the arm, and he goes back to defend
length ball, and he turns it away to the on side
length ball, and he taps it down at the wicket
full ball, but strays down the pads, and he can lob it towards midwicket. Embuldeniya gets to the ball and then falls awkwardly. Might have had his ankle turn a bit, but it didn't twist, thankfully
banged in short, and de Kock lets it pass
length ball, squares him up as he looks to defend on the on side. There's an outside edge, which takes it down towards third man
length ball, outside off, and holds its line. Bowled at 136kph, and just beats the edge
defends a length ball outside off
outisde off, and he swings it through covers with sheer timing. Great shot, though the width on offer deserved to be punished!
strays down the pads this time, and de Kock plays it off his pads, but there's a short fine leg in position
similar line, starts on middle and turns further away, and he gets the glance going, but cannot beat short fine leg
this time he goes back and plays it with the turn, from middle towards leg, down towards square leg
turns from a length, and there's an appeal from behind the wicket. Were they looking for leg-before?
comes forward to defend a length ball
full toss, and he drills it down the ground, but long on will cover this one
defends a length ball from the crease
defends a length ball
length ball, straightens into him at 136kph, and he leans into a forward defensive shot towards short midwicket
defends a length ball
length ball, outside off, and he plays it with an open face of the bat towards gully
length ball, and de Kock pulls out the reverse sweep, getting it down towards backward point
sharp turn, from a length, delivered at 78kph, and he comes forward to defend

DROPPED! Tossed up, and Rabada took the bait and drove straight, and it seemed to carry to him, but his struck him on the thumb of his bowling arm. It's bleeding, and he's out of the game for the moment. Carried nicely to him, but he just didn't get his arms in the right place for it
outside off, and he leaves
straight ball, and he defends
outside off, and he lets it go through
full ball, and he drives it down towards long on
length ball, angles into him, and he defends away towards short midwicket
banged in shorter, but down the leg side, and Rabada can watch it pass by without any need to play it
short again, and this time he ducks inside it. Pitches on middle and goes down the leg side anyway
length, angles into him at 137kph, and he drives it towards midwicket
full toss, bowled at 133kph, homing in towards Rabada, and he defends it back down the wicket
angled in from outside the wicket, and de Kock looks to drive straight back
short, and he pulls it down towards long leg
straighter ball towards the leg stump, and he plays it off his pads, and they sneak through for a leg bye
short, and he whips it away towards midwicket. They amble through for two
outside off, and he drives it down towards long off
down the leg side, and he tickles it down towards fine leg
dug in short and outside off, chest-high ball, de Kock swivels on the back foot and hooks it away to deep square leg. He hobbles across to the other end
dug in short at the body, Rabada tucks it away into the leg side
on a length, angling in and skirting away past the outside edge as de Kock feels for the ball in the channel
De Kock rides the bounce of this short one outside off and secures a single to point
full and swinging into the legs, clipped away to fine leg
another chest-high short ball on middle, hooked away to long leg. 200 up for SA
short and outside off, punched through point
fuller and angling across off, no shot
back of a length, zipping back in from round the wicket and bounces over middle
short on off, Rabada gets right behind the line and defends resolutely
on a length and outside off, Rabada belts it on the up through the covers. Top-quality drive from Rabada, would have done a top-order batsman proud. Decisive footwork high elbow, and all that jazz...
here comes the bouncer outside off, nothing doing from Rabada
dug in short and outside off, de Kock pivots on the back foot, loses his balance and smites a hook to the midwicket boundary. Fifty stand off 92 balls
another short one, same result. De Kock pulls off the front foot to the square-leg boundary. Bisects the two men in the deep
really full on the legs, whipped away to deep square leg
on a length and holds its line outside off, ignored by Rabada
near yorker on off, squeezed to the covers
wide of the crease, angling into a front-foot defence back to Vishwa
pushed through outside off and turns away, jabbed to the covers off the back foot

De Kock has missed a fairly straight ball from de Silva. This is a wicket from outta nowhere for Sri Lanka. De Kock hobbles off. Pushed through on middle from round the wicket, spins away just a wee bit de Kock stays leg-side of the ball, aims a booming drive... and misses it altogether
flatter and faster outside off, punched off the back foot in the gap at the covers
slid through on off, Rabada answers with a back-foot defence
shorter on off, punched back to him
whipped off the pads behind square leg
stabbed to mid-on
shortish and outside off, Steyn reaches out for the ball and forces to mid-off
back of a length and slanting in from around the wicket, knocked away to midwicket
slower full-toss, 97kph, outside off, Steyn is waaaaay too early into his leg-side slog. It nearly grazed the off-bail
lifter on leg stump, Steyn ducks under it and lets it thud into the gloves of Dickwella
slower cutter on the pads, turned away to deep square leg
gentle little offbreak on off, Steyn hangs back and defends it back
starts on middle and breaks down the leg side. Sharp turn for de Silva, good take from Dickwella
worked away to the left of short leg and to the right of midwicket

Sri Lanka think they have their man. Umpire Gould raises his finger right away. Rabada reviews, thinking he his bat has hit the ground and not the ball. 100ks dart outside off, Rabada jabs his bat down. Has he tickled it behind to Dickwella? Ultra Edge detects a spike as Rabada hastily brings his bat down to dig it out. Rabada has to go. Well done, umpire Gould
slides on with the arm outside off, beats the batsman, as well as the keeper
Steyn runs down the track and pushes it back to the bowler
full and outside off, forward and pushed to mid-off

Vishwa, fittingly, wraps SA up for 222. Nice and full, angling in from round the wicket, tricks the No.11 into playing for the angle but it straightens late to kiss the outside edge on its way to Dickwella
... and he finds the edge right away. A fourth slip would have caught it but there's nobody there. On a length, slanting away just a shade outside off, Dimuth spars at it and gets away
banged in short on middle, swings back in and cramps the batsman for room. Fended away into the leg side
full and wobbles through outside off, good leave from Dimuth
good length but too straight in line, clipped away to short midwicket
full and outside off, Dimuth chases a drive and winds up inside-edging the ball towards midwicket
very full and swinging in at 135kph, off the pad and wanders away to fine leg. It was surely nipping down the leg side
back of a length and shoved down leg, nothing doing from the batsman
good length and swinging down leg again
back of a length on off, Dimuth presses forward and blocks back
good length and swerving down leg again, away from the reach of Dimuth. Rabada can't control the swing
tickled off the pads with the inswing to fine leg
back of a length and angling away outside off, ignored
on a length and angling away outside off, run away towards point with soft hands
swings back in sharply from a length, cramps the batsman for room, fended away to the leg side
pitched up and homing away outside off, left alone
good length, swings back in, bounces as Steyn as Dimuth falling over the flick. Struck too high
back of a length on off, Dimuth covers up in defence
back of a length and smacks the thigh pad, but not threatening the stumps
on a length and slanting away outside off, Thirimanne hangs back and pokes a single to the leg side
back of a length and angling across off, ignored
full and angling across off, 141ks, Dimuth inside-edges a drive to mid-on
back of a length on off, 143ks, defended to cover
shorter and running away outside off, Dimuth ignores it
nice and full on off, 143ks, played back to Rabada
short and fizzing through outside off, left alone
much fuller and angling across off, left alone
shorter and outside off, run away towards point
full on off, nips back in, defended to midwicket
swing and bounce from Steyn. Kicks up from a good length and swerves back in to cramp Thirimanne for room. He looses his grip and fends it away to the leg side
short and outside off, left alone
bouncer on middle, Dimith ducks under it
pitched up and slanting away outside off, left alone
short and at off, 140ks, fended away to the leg side
back of a length on off, blocked back down the itch
edged but does not carry. Fuller than a good length and swerving away outside off, Rabada finds the outside edge, threads second and third slip and sneaks away for four
pitched further up and outside off, Dimuth doesn't meet the pitch but manages to drive the ball through the covers
short on off, hangs back and fends it away to the leg side
deflected away to fine leg off the inside edge
on a length and outside off, the bottom hand flies off the bat as Dimuth scoops a drive to mid-off
just short of a length on off, Dimuth gets right behind the line in defence
short and outside off, ignored
full and angling across off, no shot
on the pads, turned away to square leg
on a length on off, blocked to mid-on
good length on off, defended solidly to cover
bouncer on middle, ducks under it
on a length and on off, defended to cover off the front foot
very full on middle and leg, clipped away to the right of short midwicket
back of a length on off, defended off the back foot
back of a length and angling across off, left alone
pitched up and angling across off, left alone
nice and full on off, Thirimanne inches forward and taps the ball to mid-off
just short of a length and outside off, Thirimanne hangs his bat out and edges it away, threading the cordon for another four
strays on to the pads, and he flicks it away for four
length ball, angles across him, and he defends from the crease
length, a bit fuller, and bowled at 143kph, and it jams Karunaratne's handle as he defends from the crease
length ball, straight, and he defends from the crease
length, outside off, and he leaves
jaffa! Pitches on a length, outside off, and then forces him to poke at it. Too good for him, though,as it carries on with the angle and beats the outside edge
angles across from a length, and he leaves, after initially thinking about having a go at that ball
pitched up, angles across him, at 138kph, and he goes back and defends off the middle of the bat
angles across him from a length, and he defends off the backfoot. Loud 'no' to discourage his partner from thinking about going for a run
length, angles across him, lifts a little as it pitches, and he does well to get up on his toes and keep the ball down as he defends towards point
CHANCE! So, so lucky. Short ball, and he was shaping to play it to the on side. Hits the shoulder of his bat and his glove, and lobs up, but lands where silly point might have been...but wasn't
length ball, angles across him, and he leaves it this time
short ball, and he ducks under it as it passes over his right shoulder
fuller ball, and almost squares up Karunaratne. He eventually sees the ball go past his inside edge and strike him around his midriff
fuller ball, and he defends from the crease. Good bowling, right at the stumps, and making him play

GOT HIM! Came in from a good length with the angle, and then just seemed to move a little, as it took the outside edge as the batsman shaped to defend from the crease. Went through to de Kock off the outside edge. They check for the no-ball, and it is close, but just good enough, I reckon?
full ball, and he defends
length ball, angles into him, and he gets up on his toes to defend it compactly
length, angles back into Thirimanne and he defends from the crease
length, outside off, and this time he slices it through point. It always looked like it might pull up, but just kept running away from Bavuma. Great shot!
short ball, and he goes back and tries to go through midwicket, but gets it off the bottom of the blade. Bowled at 129kph
thrown wider, at 136kph, and he goes for a drive but misses
short ball, outside off, and he gets up on his toes and cuts it to the left of gully. Controlled shot...lovely!
short ball again, and this time he gets up on his toes and defends the ball angled across him, delivered at 139kph
length ball, angles into him, and Fernando defends off the crease
lovely ball! Good length, just outside off, and full enough to draw a forward prod from Fernando. Beats the outside edge and goes through to the keeper
good length ball, bowled at 140kph, outside off, and this time Fernando presses forward and defends

are they going to refer this? Yes they are. Looking for a caught behind! Length ball, outside off, and Fernando went with the forward prod again, and it appeared to have missed the edge quite clearly on its way through to de Kock. WOW! It really is a stinker. That ball was travelling through Pretoria, so much was the distance against the bat!
length ball, jags back into Fernando, and beats the outside edge again! Dies on its way through to de Kock too. Will variable bounce be a factor too? And soon?
length ball, outside off, good bounce through, as Fernando lets this pass. Went through at 147kph
full, angles across him at 143kph, and he leaves it
lovely ball! Angles across him, rising from a length, and beats the outside edge as he prods
length ball, 139kph, and he flicks it towards short midwicket
short, and he goes back and cuts it again up on his toes. This time, they have a man stationed three-quarters of the way to the point fence

CHOPPED ON! Length ball, but cutting back into him, and Fernando looks to play from the crease. It takes the inside edge and goes on to the stumps. Just hits the base of leg stump, so he is unlucky in a sense, but just reward for what has been a great spell from Olivier. He needed to adjust his length to a bit fuller, and has done it quite effectively
banged in short, but down the leg side, and he lets it pass
length ball, and he gets up on his toes to defend it from the crease
wide of the crease, fuller length, and he defends from the crease yet again. This was bowled at 143kph
wide of the crease again, on a length, and he taps it towards point. This was 141kph
length, swings away at 141kph, and he leaves
length ball, 142kph, and it squares him, gets the outside edge too, but it runs on the bounce towards gully!

length, outside off, and he comes forward to defend. Comes off the outside of the bat, but goes past gully towards backward point. At 139kph, the slowest ball of this over. Good time for Steyn to have a go, with about 19 minutes of play left...
fuller, angles across him, takes the outside edge at 141kph, but drops just short of Bavuma at gully
length ball, and he plays it off the backfoot with soft hands, and immediately calls through for a single
short, but into his body, and he flicks it away towards square leg. Beautiful shot, especially with a short leg in place

SAVED! Another ball dug in short at 142kph, and it goes off the shoulder of the blade and pops up. That seemed to stay up for a long while, but still landed short of a sprawling Bavuma at gully. So close, really...
short, and he goes back and punches it towards extra cover. Glorious shot!
fuller, and at 139kph, and he comes forward from the crease to defend this

edged, but not gone to hand! Terrific ball again from Steyn, full from wide of the crease, and took the edge, but just went past Markram at third slip. He seemed to get a finger on to it, but it was always going away
short, and nasty. Goes into him, and he takes his eyes off it momentarily. The ball takes his glove and then goes into his midriff
length, and he defends. This was delivered at 141kph. It's a good old battle for survival for these batsmen right now
length, fast, but wide, and he lobs it over covers off the backfoot
length, but outside off, and he can shoulder arms to this one
length, and beats the outside edge as Thirimanne tentatively pokes at it. This was bowled at 143kph!
oversteps in trying to bowl it quick. Short, and going into him, and he steers it off his face towards short midwicket
length, outside off, and he leaves it
fuller ball, and he drives it straight down the ground. Hits it well enough to beat mid on
top ball! Pitches outside off and then just goes a shade away. Had come in with the angle, and made him look to defend straight down the wicket. Too good for him
fuller, and on leg stump, and he whips it away towards long leg
outside off, and beats the forward defensive quite comfortably too. Mendis is not reading the ball when it's fuller, and outside the off stump

the extra ball comes in handy! This time the ball is on a length, just outside off, and Mendis can't help but have a poke at it, and it takes the top part of the bat on its way through to de Kock. Good bowling, and perseverance paying off for the hosts.
length, outside off, at 141kph, and he defends
fuller, but wider, and he leaves it. Bowled at 137kph, and Thirimanne was confident it wasn't going to do enough to jag back in
length ball, shapes into him, but starts from way outside off, and he can leave it. This was delivered at 139kph
length, and opens him up with a ball at 143kph, and he is able to keep it out somehow as it hones in on his off stump
short, and he goes back and plays it away towards long leg. They take the single...
full ball, and it takes part of the outside of the bat, and lobs back...but lands well short of Steyn. What an apt way to finish the day
short and aimed at the body from over the wicket, Thirimanne looks away, takes his eyes off the ball, ducks into it and cops a blow on his shoulder
back of a length and on the hips, Thirimanne tucks a single to long leg and exposes Rajitha
short and angling into middle, 138ks, Rajitha sits back and fends it back to the bowler
short and outside off, ignored by Rajitha
short and angling in from wide of the crease, 138ks, then straightens to square up Rajitha, take the outside edge, and drop in front of gully
on a length and angling in at off, defended to cover off the front foot
back of a length and slanting away outside off, encouraging carry to the keeper, left alone
pitched up and slanting wider outside off, no shot from Thirimanne again
short and outside off, Thirimanne does not bother with this as well
on a length and angling away just a shade outside off, Thirimanne plays at this and defends it back to Rabada
short on the hips, glanced down to long leg for one
on a length and kicks up at off, 144ks, pings the splice and rolls back to him
full and on the pads, worked away through square leg by Thirimanne

Olivier takes an excellent return catch. He dives to his right from his followthrough and latches onto the ball. On a length and on middle, Olivier finds some extra bounce. The bat turns in Thirimanne's hands as he limply chips it right back. Thirimanne misses another opportunity
short and attacking the body, 141ks, looked a lot quicker than that. Kusal leaps and cops a blow on his mid-riff. Ouch!
lifter on leg stump, 142ks, Kusal ducks under it. The umpire says one for the over
good length and on off, 143ks, defended back to Olivier
back of a length and skipping away outside off, Kusal feels for the ball and is beaten in the channel
on a length, kicking and screaming away past the outside edge
pitched up and outside off, Rajitha stays back and scoops a drive to the left of cover
dug in short and outside off, punched off the back foot to point
back of a length and outside off, 145ks, Rajitha jabs at it and watches the ball fizz past the outside edge

Rabada knocks over the nightwatchman! Back of a length, angling in towards off stump, so Rajitha looks to cover up the angle. Instead, the ball seams away so very late to hit the top of off. That might have got a top-order batsman as well. Two wickets in two overs for SA. SL 66 for 6
lifter outside off, de Silva sways his upper body out of the way
short on middle, Kusal gets behind the line and plays back to the bowler
full and wide outside off, 138ks, Kusal reaches out for the ball and here comes the devil-may-care slap over cover-point. He held nothing back
on a length on middle and leg, tip and run in front of midwicket
full and swerving in at off, de Silva hangs back and pushes the ball to mid-on
back of a length and angling in and zipping away past the iffy prod of de Silva
inswinging yorker, finishes on off at 140ks, dug out
overpitched and outside off, 142ks, Kusal brings his strong bottom hand into play and shovel-drives it through extra-cover
shorter and snaking away past the outside edge near the shoulder of the bat
back of a length and outside off, 144ks, smeared away to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, Kusal punches this 145ks ball on the up but can't get it past Bavuma at short cover
on a length and angling into middle from round the wicket, 148ks, Kusal uses the pace of Rabada to his advantage and slides it away fine on the off side with an open face. Tickled to third man
fullish and outside off, 141ks, Kusal extends his arms and launches it up and over extra-cover. Whoa, what a strike from Kusal. Puts Rabada on the roof
edged but does not carry to Elgar. On a length and moves away outside off, prodded away to third slip
De Silva hangs back to a full ball on middle and leg and flicks it away to the midwicket boundary
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and glides it away towards point
short and sits up to be hit, De Silva picks it from outside off and nails a pull to the left of Markram at short leg. Bam!
on a length and outside off, de Silva plays with soft hands and slides it down to gully with an open face
pitched up and outside off, de Silva slides it with an open face again, this time gets it in the gap between slips and gully

Rabada has Kusal nicking off for 20. SL six down and sinking. On a length, angling in towards off from round the wicket, then straightens away in the channel. Kusal spars at it and edges it behind to the keeper. Lightning doesn't strike twice
on a length and angling in at off, Dickwella stretches out and drives the ball straight of mid-off. Olivier chases hard and keeps it to two
on a length and wide outside off, Dickwella reaches out for the ball and scythes it away to fine third man
short and angling in at off, De Silva flaps a pull over Bavuma at short midwicket
short and speared at the hips, 148ks, de Silva is late onto the flick and wears it on the pad
full and outside off, left alone by de Silva
bouncer, slanting away outside off, Dickwella sways his upper body out of the way and lets it go
on a length and outside off, 141ks, Dickwella batters it away straight of mid-on and fetches a boundary. Shovelled away with the bottom hand
short and banged down leg, Dickwella swats it away like a fly fine of Rabada at long leg. Hit flat and hard for six
dug short and outside off, pulled away to midwicket. Front-foot no-ball
bouncer outside off, Dickwella shelves the ramp and ignores it
on a length and outside off, dabbed through point with an open face
pitched up and outside off, de Silva unfurls a pretty on-drive and finds the boundary. He didn't over-hit it, simply showed the full face of the bat and timed the pants off this
on a length and nipping away outside off, Dickwella chases a booming drive... and misses
back of a length, skids back in at 144ks, catches the batsman on the crease, off the pad but doesn't carry to slip
bouncer on leg stump or even outside it, Dickwella swats at it and collects fresh air
on a length and angling across off, 140ks, blocked to short cover
on a length and outside off, skewed to the leg side off the inside half of the bat for one
back of a length and on the hips, glanced away through square leg off the back foot
full and on a fourth-stump line, guided to gully
back of a length and angling in at off stump, worked away to midwicket off the back foot
De Silva bends forward and defends this full ball on off to cover
on a length and holds its line outside off, ignored
short and attacking off, 133ks, blocked off the back foot
yorker, swerves in at off, de Silva keeps it out
short and wide outside off, wider than a set of stumps outside off. Dickwella reaches out for the ball and slices it over point
Dickwella at his best! Short and angling in at off from round the wicket, Dickwella gives himself room and ramps it over the top of Amla at slip like only he can
back of a length and outside off, Dickwella has a massive heave-ho to the leg side... and misses
short and holds its line outside off, Dickwella leaps and punches the ball to short cover
full and wide outside off, Dickwella aims a big drive, plays away from the body, and is beaten emphatically
full and outside off, creeps in from wide of the crease, Dickwella is beaten outside off
on a length and outside off, defended off the front foot
short and outside off, defended again

Maiden Test wicket for Mulder. Dale Steyn is thrilled for the debutant. Perfectly pitched ball, catches de Silva on the crease. It leaves the batsman a wee bit and finds the outside edge which is snaffled by de Kock
full ball, 132kph, outside off, and he comes forward and defends
length ball, cuts back into him, and he defends off the inside part of the blade, away to the leg side
length ball, cuts back into him, and strikes him on the pads. Vociferous appeal, but they seem to agree that it pitched and struck him outside the line as he shaped to defend. No referral made
length, outside off, and he steers it down towards third man. A man at fly slip goes across to his left and cuts it off
length, outside off, and he plays a rasping drive through covers. Top shot!
length, outside off, 135kph, and he cuts it away towards backward point
length, thrown a bit wide, and Lakmal has an almighty lash at that. Not surprisingly, misses by a mile!
length ball, straight into off stump, and he defends from the crease
full, on off stump, 142kph, and he plays a beautiful straight drive past Steyn. What a shot...something that would do any specialist top-order player proud
floated up outside off, and he paddle-sweeps it towards long leg. It's Rabada who tries to cut it off, but it seems to have touched the rope. Or at least he was beyond the fence when he touched it
tries to play the reverse sweep to a length ball, and misses. That didn't miss the leg stump by much
dropped shorter, and he can go back and play it away towards long leg
comes forward and defends a length ball
short, and turning away, and he goes back and plays it towards covers. Well struck, but cannot beat the fielder there
fuller ball, and he looks to defend, but gets the outside edge. It runs past first slip towards third man
length, outside off, and he leaves
lenght, and he picks it up from outside off and whips it towards midwicket. It's a tight two they aim for, but make it easily in the end, as the throw doesn't make it on time
length ball, and he moves across his stumps and tries the scoop over the wicketkeeper. Misses out on contact
length, outside off, and he leaves it this time

length, and this time he nails the scoop over the keeper! Walked across the stumps, and got into position to just get it off the lower portion of the bat, using Mulder's pace to guide it over de Kock!
length, 130kph, and chases him as he looks to back away. He was still trying to play a delicate cut, but missed out on contact
presses forward to a length ball and defends
goes back to shorten the length of a straight ball, and pulls it towards midwicket
length, and he sweeps it down towards long leg
length ball, grips after pitching on middle, and beats both the off stump and the outside edge
bowled from wider of the crease, and pitched right up. He comes forward to defend

Maharaj fires in a quicker one from wide of the crease, and they have referred it after Ian Gould gives it out! Nothing wrong with the front foot, he plays it off the back foot, and there's no inside edge. Just down to tracking now...and it hits leg stump. Another one goes for Sri Lanka!
length ball, on off stump, and he defends towards short cover
length ball, and he goes for a pull. Seems to hit his arm and pop up towards first slip. Lands well short, though
fuller, angles across him, and he moves away and tries to run it down towards point. Didn't miss off stump by much
short, and he moves across to the on side and tries to ramp it....just guides it high and towards Dean Elgar, who takes a good catch at point, running backwards and over his shoulder
length, outside off, and he defends from the crease
length, outside off, and he defends from the crease
length, but straighter, and he flicks it towards square leg
length, 130kph, outside off, and he defends from the crease
length, and he presses forward and pushes it to the right of cover
shorter, angles across him, and he goes back and plays it towards point with soft hands. The call is immediate, as is the response from Markram
full, outside off, and he leaves it. Bowled at 128kph
length, a hint of swing away at 132k, and he leaves it
fuller, a bit wide, and some shape away. Elgar gets close to it, and considers having a go with the bat, but then draws it back at the last instant
fuller ball, and he seemed to have lost it for a bit. 130kph, and he eventually smothers it by his feet
length, outside off, and he wants nothing to do with it
goes from wide of the crease, and angles this one in. Hits the pad, and there's an appeal, but it would have been going down leg
length ball, outside off, and he defends it towards covers
length ball, angles into him, and he defends from the crease
length, starts from outside off and shapes back in, and he plays it defensively. Thinks about a quick single towards covers, but quickly turns his partner down
length, straighter, and he almost falls over as he tries to defend. Able to cover the line and get his bat down in time, though
length, wide of off, 133kph, and he leaves
length, outside off, and he leaves

length, angles across Markram, who looks to drive it on the up. Takes the outer part of the bat, and goes towards point. They go for one, and then Elgar wants a second, but is sent back. A good, quick throw could have had him in trouble
length, outside off, and he comes forward and defends
bowled from wide of the crease, angles into him from a length, and he defends
length, outside off, and he defends it towards covers
fuller, on leg stump, and he shapes to flick, but can only play it towards square leg
length, but down leg side, and he can glance it down to fine leg
length, outside off, and he defends
good length, but the line is awry. Starts from leg and then swings further down. Good take by Dickwella, sprawling away to his left
length, straight, and he plays it towards midwicket
length, and he pushes forward to defend. It takes the outer edge and flies low towards gully, who does well to stop it away to his right
gorgeous! The line continues to be outside off, but the length is just a bit too full, and he comes forward and meets it with the middle of the bat and drives it past the bowler
length ball, and he defends
length, and he comes forward and defends the ball, aimed at his off stump

that's the breakthrough! Just as lunch is called, Vishwa Fernando picks up his fifth for this Test. Good length, in that channel just outside off, and it straightens after pitching, with Elgar looking to defend with the incoming angle from over the wicket. Takes a feather edge through to Dickwella, and Vishwa is cock-a-hoop! Excellent bowling, and crucial breakthrough that will make lunch a whole lot more palatable in the Lankan dressing room
fuller and sliding away outside off with the angle from over the stumps, nothing doing from Amla
really full at off stump, jabbed back to Vishwa
on the pads, flicked away with the inswing to long leg
fuller on the pads, clipped away to fine leg once again
nice and full, angling into middle, Amla blocks back to the bowler
jumps from a length at off, Amla yanks his bottom hand off the bat and drops the ball to the off side
short and slanting in at the top of off, Amla punchily defends it back to the bowler
on a length and bounces outside off, Amla lets it go
short and at top of off, fended back
back of a length and angling into leg stump, a whirl of the wrists from Amla sends the ball rolling away through square leg
pretty full and outside off, driven off the front foot to the left of short cover
just short of a good length and outside off, Amla gets on top of the ball and languidly punches on the up through extra-cover. So easy on the eye...
banged in short and down the leg side, Amla shuffles across off but doesn't connect with a pull
good length and on off, Amla covers up in defence
really full on the pads, clipped away to midwicket
back of a length and swings back in with some extra bounce, Amla loosens his grip and defends it to the leg side off the back foot to close out the over
back of a length and attacking off, jabbed to the covers off the back foot
short and outside off, stands tall and punches to mid-on
short and wide, Markram latches onto it and cracks it in front of square. Delightful timing
on a length and angling in at off, played back down the pitch
full and swinging into the pads, tickled to fine leg
on a length and bounces in the channel, nothing doing from Amla
length, but offers width, and he smacks it over covers. Good shot, because that was nothing more than a loosener, and had to be latched on to!
length, but down the leg side this time. He shapes to glance it, but gets nowhere close to the ball
length, better line, just outside off, 135kph, and he leaves
length, outside off, and he defends
length, straighter, and he defends from the crease

GONE! How did he give his wicket away? It was a full ball, on his pads, and he was looking to whip it away on the on side, but just failed to keep it down. Oshada Fernando dives away to his right at short midwicket and emerges with the ball in his hands. Top catch!
Amla gets on top of a short ball outside off and punches up through extra-cover
nice and full, angling in on middle, shuffles across off and pats it down to mid-on
fullish and angling into off, Amla defends it back to the bowler with soft hands
short and skids on off, Amla plays a jabbing punch to cover
good length and just a shade outside off, run away towards point
back of a length and outside off, defended to short cover
short at the hips, deflected away to fine leg
overpitched and outside off, caressed away to sweeper cover
nice and full just a shade outside off, defended back to the bowler
really full on off, nudged away to mid-on
back of a length and outside off, ignored
overpitched and outside off, driven back as Rabada stops it
full and homing in at off, defended off the front foot to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, blocked
pitched up and bending away outside off, ignored
short on middle and leg, defended to mid-on off the back foot
full on off, Amla gets behind the line and defends stoutly
back of a length and angling in from wide of the crease, jammed to the leg side
full and speared outside off, Bavuma ignores it
full, angling in, straightening to draw a leading edge to the cover-point region
full and outside off, Amla has a waft at it and edges it away between slips and gully. No protection at deep third man to cut it off
short on off, Amla jumps on top of it and punches the ball to mid-off
full and outside off, pushed to covers off the front foot
full and outside off, driven straight of mid-off. Vishwa hunts the ball down
full and angling into a leg-side flick to midwicket's right
short and outside off, punched down to mid-off
pitched up and outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
short and outside off, swivel-pulled away to deep square leg
full and wobbles away outside off, left alone
tucked off the pads towards the leg side
on a length, angling in and straightening away past the outside edge
short and outside off, leans back and punches to sweeper
on a length on off, tipped to the covers off the front foot
Amla checks his drive and plays a length ball up to cover
on a length and wobbles away outside off, ignored
full and around off, prodded to gully with an open face
hip-high short ball on middle, Amla swivels back and pulls it away to deep backward square leg
full and angling across off, inside-edged away to the right of midwicket for a single
pitched up and angling across off, no shot from Amla
short on off, defended off the back foot
short and slanting away outside off, ignored

Dropped? Vishwa nearly gets Amla for the second time in the match. Dug in short and slanting away outside off with the angle from over the wicket. It gets big on Amla, but he still dares to hook it away against the angle. He top-edges the ball, but first slip shells it
full and outside off, driven back, Rajitha stretches out his right leg and stops the ball with some nifty footwork
pitched up and outside off, left alone
full and outside off, driven up to mid-on off the front foot
full and swings away outside off, left alone again
full and nips back in, but not enough. Bavuma pads up to it
yorker, dips on off, dug out
fullish and angling across off, left alone
on the hips and Amla tucks the ball away to long leg
very full and outside off, jabbed away towards mid-off
poked to the leg side via an inside edge
wide of the crease, angling in at off, this full ball is defended off the front foot by Bavuma
short on middle and leg, knocked away to the leg side
length, outside off, seaming in, and Amla comes forward to defend. That was bowled at an impressive 139kph
length, outside off and this time moving away from him, and he lets it pass
length, and he covers the line outside off and defends
length, and he goes back and punches it through covers
length, seaming in with the angle, and he defends

what a good ball! Length, and just outside off stump, and drew a tentative poke forward from Bavuma. Got a healthy nick, and Dickwella does well to move to his right and take a good, low catch. Rajitha pumps his fists. Sri Lanka keep snapping away with the wickets...
length, angled across him at 139kph, and he comes forward to defend
length, angles away from him at 134kph, and this time he runs it delicately past gully towards backward point
oh, he bowls a full toss, right on off stump. All du Plessis has to do is lean in to it and drive it through the covers
fuller, straighter, and a good ball, which makes him open up to defend it
full again, but outside off, and he eases into a drive. Gorgeous! Bowled at 141kph, but he found the gap between mid-off and cover to perfection
length, but down leg side, and he can play it off his hips towards long leg
full, but down leg stump, and he flicks it off his pads
length, slants in with the angle, and he leaves. Doesn't miss the off stump by much, but du Plessis trusts the bounce on this pitch
length, outside off, and he leaves. Just a hint of movement away from him, at 133kph
length, and appeared to hold up on the pitch even though it was bowled at 138kph, and du Plessis drops it dead after pressing forward
length, and he drives this towards mid off
fuller, and he presses forward and defends this ball outside off stump
length, across him at 138kph, and he leaves
length, but straying on to the pads, and he can work it off his hips towards backward square leg
length, and angles across him at 140kph, and he defends this from the crease
length, and angles away from him after pitching on off, and he watches it through behind the wicket
shorter in length, and he tries to play it off his hips as it pitches on leg. Hits his thigh pad and trickles down towards square leg
short, but straight, and he can glance it after shuffling across and gets it down to fine leg
full ball, and he defends off the front foot
full ball, and he drives it with the turn towards long on
length ball, tossed up on off, and he defends. Takes the outer edge of the bat, but along the ground
goes back to defend a flatter straight ball
fuller, and he can drive this down towards long on
presses forward and defends a length ball pitching on off stump
length, coming back into du Plessis, and he defends watchfully off the front foot
fuller, but on his pads, and he whips it off his legs towards deep midwicket after moving forward to meet the ball under his eyes
length ball, outside off at 134kph, and he lets it pass as it shapes away from him
length, outside off, 135kph, and hint of shape away, as du Plessis lets it pass
length, and he uses the depth of the crease to punch it off towards covers
length, but on his pads, and he whips it away towards backward square leg
length, outside off, turning in, and he steps across and defends
presses forward to smother a length ball on off stump, bowled at 77kph
sharp turn from outside off, and he looks to flick it. Lands close to short leg, but just short!
some turn from middle, and opens Amla up as he shapes to defend
presses forward to defend
fuller, and on leg stump, and he can whip it off his pads towards midwicket
short, straight, and he hops on his toes and flicks it away towards short midwicket
length ball, and he defends
short ball, and too short for du Plessis to require anything to do with it. One called for the over
short, and he goes back and works it towards midwicket
shapes away from him at 140kph after pitching on a good length just outside off. Amla lets it pass through
fuller, 140kph again, and angles across Amla, who lets it pass
short, and he moves back and smashes it through covers. Good shot!

takes the outside edge, but eludes first slip! Length ball, that pitched on off, and didn't turn as much as du Plessis expected. Took the edge, and just went past Kusal Mendis, who was quite wide at first slip. Chance that hasn't been taken...
length, turning into him from off, and he plays it with a defensive bat towards short leg
full, straight, and he is able to push it down the ground towards long on
length, outside off, and Amla presses forward to smother it
turn from outside off, and Amla plays it with a dead bat, with the turn, towards short leg
length, outside off, at 136kph, and moving further away, and he leaves
length, outside off, and he lets it pass, as it moves further away after pitching
length, outside off, and he watches it through to the keeper
length, but width on offer, and he eases it through extra cover
length, movement off the seam after pitching outside off, and he leaves it
shorter, and straighter, and he can drop it with a dead bat towards short midwicket and pick up a quick single
presses forward to defend a length ball on off stump
length, turning into him, a touch quicker at 80kph, and du Plessis does well to go back and maneouvre it away towards midwicket

Mendis takes this one! Big wicket this! Hashim Amla plays for the turn to a fuller ball that was pitched on off stump. Didn't turn, took the outside edge, and Kusal Mendis at first slip makes no mistake this time. An important breakthrough for the Lankans
presses forward and defends a length ball on off stump
tosses this up, 78kph, on leg stump, and de Kock stretches forward to defend it
short, and he goes back and cuts it towards extra cover
length, straight at him, and he defends it. Bowled at 134kph
length, a little wider outside off, and he presses forward to meet it with a dead bat
length, angles across him, and he covers the movement and defends it towards mid on

what have you done here, QdK! Length ball again, angles across him, and he shapes to play this on the onside, but the ball sticks in the surface and takes the outside edge as he tries to close the face of the bat from a side-on stance. The ball carries back to Lakmal, who catches this one gleefully. Apt reward for the senior Sri Lanka seamer, who bowled very well without ample returns even yesterday. What a wicket to take on the stroke of tea for Sri Lanka!
greets a full ball with a forward stride, and just pushes it to through mid off!
length ball, angles into him and he plays it away towards square leg
slower through the air and on off, defended
pushed through on middle, defended
fuller and outside off, du Plessis gets forward and drives back to the bowler
flatter and fired on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket off the front foot
full on middle and leg, angling in at the stumps, Mulder props forward and drives to mid-on
good length and largely holds its line on off stump, defended back to Lakmal
good length and around off, Mulder props forward and again and works a single to the midwicket region
pitched up and wobbling away outside off, du Plessis does not reach the pitch, so he winds up scooping the ball to mid-off
back of a length and angling in at middle stump, whisked away to mid-on off the front foot
good length and angling in at off, du Plessis cries 'Nooo' as he pushes the ball straight to mid-on off the front foot
full and spinning in at off stump, Mulder camps back and defends it
Mulder dashes down the track, gets too close to the pitch of this full ball on off and jabs it back to de Silva

The drift gets Mulder and leaves SA six down. Tossed up full, angling in at off stump, then drifts away. Mulder plants his front leg, jabs with hard hands, and edges it to first slip. SA have slid either side of the tea break
tossed up and breaks in at off, Maharaj bends forward in defence and keeps it out
nice and full, turns in, Maharaj hangs back and defends it to the off side
floated up at off stump, Maharaj gets forward and defends to round out a wicket-maiden from de Silva
shortish and outside off, du Plessis rides the bounce and drops the ball to the point region
back of a length and angling in at off, played back to the bowler off the front foot
dug in short at off, defended off the back foot to cover
back of a length and outside off, knocked down to long-on off the front foot
full and holds its line outside off, Maharaj covers his off stump and lets it go
lifter outside off, Maharaj ducks under it carefully
flighted on middle and leg, flicked away to deep midwicket

Siriwardana throws the stumps down at the non-striker's end. Maharaj is in danger. Maharaj runs down the track and drills down to mid-off and sets off for a risky single. He does a bit of ball-watching, switches his lines as opposed to running straight, and somehow makes his ground in the end to beat the substitute
length-ball offbreak, blocked back on middle stump
dropped short and wide outside off, goes on the back foot and slaps it away to sweeper cover
worked to the right of mid-on
full on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
full and on off, tip and run to mid-on, a fumble helps SA's cause
short and outside off, punched on the up to the right of short cover
back of a length and around off, glided to gully
very full on middle and leg, Faf closes the face and whips it firmly through midwicket. Shot!
full and wobbling away outside off, ignored
short and angling in at off, defended to mid-off off the back foot
slides on outside off, pushed to extra-cover off the front foot
on a length and drifts away outside off, jabbed back to de Silva
flatter on leg stump, Maharaj goes low and sweeps straight to square leg
full, dips and turns in at off, blocked to cover
tossed outside off, Faf stretches out and stabs it back to the bowler
mighty full on off, kept out
on a length and zips back in at off, Maharaj prods forward and gets an inside edge onto the pad
on a length on off, Maharaj gets right behind the line in defence

Lakmal brings another one back into Maharaj and traps him. Maharaj chats with his captain and decides against a review. Fuller than a good length and skids back in to ping the front pad as Maharaj plays around it and is struck in front of off. Coach Ottis Gibson has his face in his hands
shortish and outside off, tapped to point with an open face
back of a length on off, jammed out
back of a length and spins in on middle, whipped away behind square on the leg side
full on middle, defended back
speared very full on middle, squeezed to point
flighted on middle, defended to the leg side
flighted outside off and spins away, dabbed to point off the front foot
skidder outside off, beats Rabada's back-foot slash
short and cramps du Plessis for room, chopped only as far as cover
on a length and outside off, punched on the up to the right of sweeper cover
Lakmal hits an in-between length and gets it to swerve away outside off. Lakmal squares up Rabada. He prods at it and edges it to Kusal Mendis to second slip
bouncer on off, Steyn ducks under it
full on off, forward and driven crisply to mid-off
back of a length on middle, defended to mid-on
good length and skids in at off, defended to the leg side
SA's procession continues. Thirimanne dives away to his right and snaffles a sharp catch. Tossed up and spins in on middle, Steyn plays a long way in front of his body and jabs a catch to short leg
full and outside off, blocked to cover off the front foot
full and dips on off, defended off the front foot
flighted on off, run away past slip

Four wickets for de Silva. Hang on, has has overstepped by a big margin. Du Plessis has been called back and the SL coach has his hands on his head now. De Silva wears a wry smile. Du Plessis dared to step down the track and hit the spinner down the track. But the ball shoots low and sneaks under his bat to the keeper. Dickwella does the rest but it amounts to nothing. Non-turner, again, from de Silva and it nearly got du Plessis
speared down leg, excellent diving take from Dickwella
full and slanting in at off, wafted to the leg side off the inside edge
on a length and angling in on middle, defended
kicks up from a length and hits the splice, defended back to the bowler
inswinging yorker, dug out

appeal for lbw, not given. But Dimuth goes for a review. I reckon the height is the issue here. On a length and seams back in sharply, beats the inside edge and strikes the flap on the front pad. The tracks confirms it was bouncing over. SL kept waiting for the last wicket
shuffles across and works it away defensively to the leg side. He survives the over
pushed through on middle, Du Plessis ventures a sweep and misses. This is the slider from Dananjaya, so doesn't turn. Not given out lbw. SL go for another review. This is heading down leg
whipped from outside off to deep midwicket and Faf exposes Olivier
poked past slip for one
skids on outside off, punched to sweeper cover for one
tickled off the pads fine on the leg side for four
tossed outside off, driven to cover

Faf searches for two, but looks like Olivier has been caught short... or not. Tickled away through square leg. Faf hares back for the second, as does Olivier. He stretches out and makes his ground. Lakmal takes the bails off at his end, but Olivier is in
whipped away to the right of midwicket. Faf brings up a half-century, SA need more from their captain

Another nip-backer from Lakmal. Full and moves back in to hit the front pad on the knee-roll as the No.11 plays around his front pad. No inside edge involved, the tracker returns umpire's call on leg stump
short and angling across off, fended away to long leg
Thirimanne hangs back and inside-edges an inswinger to the leg side
full and slanting in from round the wicket, but does not threaten off. So, left alone
back of a length and angling into a leg-side flick to midwicket
pitched up and outside off, no shot offered
wafted to square leg off the inside half
back of a length and angling across off stump, no shot
on a length and slanting away, left alone outside off
full on middle from round the wicket, pushed to mid-on
on a length and outside off, no shot
back of a length and jags back in, left alone
bouncer on off, ducks under it
length ball, outside off, and he pushes it towards point
lenght, outside off at 140kph, and he leaves
fuller ball, straighter, and brisk at 140kph, and he defends from the crease
length, angling into him and he defends
jags back from a length and raps him on the pads, but the height would have surely taken it over leg stump
length, and swings back in from the angle of release, wide of the crease. He leaves, and it just goes past the off stumps without disturbing the bails. Bowled at 139kph
full, and strays down the leg side. He shapes to glance, and gets it off the pads. Runs fine, for four. Every run counts here!
length, wide outside off, 148kph, and he leaves
shorter in length, and coming back into him, and he defends. Good pace at 149kph!
length, pops up from a length, and he is caught trying to move forward. Just hits the inside of his bat and goes into his body. Doesn't pop up, though!
length, outside off at 148kph, and he can leave
length, and outside off, and he can push it past cover
angles into him from a length, at 142kph, and he defends
fuller, straightens into him, 143 clicks, and he gets an inside edge down towards fine leg
length ball, jags back into him, and traps him inside the crease. Slanting down leg side
length, angles into him, 142kph, and hits him, probably on his box, as he plays back
dug in short, and he ducks into it
length, and he picks it off the stumps and plays it towards midwicket. They think about a quick single, but he turns his partner down
length, 140kph, and angles into him, and he presses forward to defend
short, and he goes back and cuts it over gully. No third man in place...
length, straightens into him, and he is forced to defend
length, outside off, and he shoulders arms to it once he sees it shape away from him
length, a bit fuller, and faster at 142kph, but still outside off, and he lets it pass
shorter in length, angles into him, 143kph, and he gets up high to defend this
length, bowled at 140kph, straightens into him, and he defends from the crease. A bit of extra bounce from a good length seems to surprise him, but he takes his bottom hand off
length, outside off, shaping back in at 138kph, and he defends from the crease
fuller, outside off, he goes for a booming drive, and misses out! Not far from the outside edge, too!
fuller, but on the pads, and he can flick this one away towards midwicket. It goes slowly, but enough to tease the man running from square leg, and eventually has the legs to get to the boundary
length ball, 143kph, cuts back into him, and he defends from the crease
full, straight, and smacked straight back towards long on. Top shot!
length, coming back into him at 141kph, and he defends off the back foot towards short midwicket
length, outside off at 146kph, and he comes forward and defends it comfortably
fuller, straighter, and he picks it away to the left of mid on and immediately calls his captain through for a single
length, outside off, 147kph, and he shoulders arms to it
length ball, but swings back in towards him, at 143kph, and he can play it off his pads towards square leg
stretches forward to meet a length ball, 142kph, outside off, and drives it to cover
length, just outside off, and makes him jump as he defends. Adjusts to some late seam movement to play it softly down at the pitch
fuller, but strays down the pads again, and he can tickle this down towards fine leg
fuller, but straight, and he plays it off his pads towards midwicket. Olivier seems to have pulled this back, though
short, and he picks the length early, leans back and slots this one towards midwicket. Perhaps not off the middle, but good enough
length, delivered from wide of the crease, but starts outside off, and he leaves
length, and he plays it off the crease as it comes into him with the angle. Still keeping a speed of 141kph!
length, closer to the outside edge, as the ball starts outside off, goes at 143kph. Tentative poke forward from Thirimanne

got the edge this time! Similar ball to the last one, started just outside off, and held its line at good pace. Thirimanne held his bat out tentatively...it took the edge, and de Kock did the rest. Vital breakthrough for the South Africans
zips off a good length, 141kph, just outside off, and he has to quickly draw his bat away from it
fuller, outside off, and he comes forward to meet it. It drops towards short cover. He wants a single, but Karunaratne sends him back
short, and he gets on top of it with his wrists and guides it down to fine leg. This was hurled at 140kph too!
length, jams back into him, and he gets up on his toes and plays this 139kph ball down towards long leg

length, angles across him, and he has nicked this through! This went at 135kph, and more than the pace it was the angle. Karunaratne gets sucked into going forward, and the natural angle away from him takes a feather edge through to de Kock. Karunaratne was looking solid. This could send some shock waves through the dressing room
banged in shorter, and he defends from the crease
fuller, outside off, and he lets this pass
length, outside off, and he leaves it as it moves further away. This was bowled at 135kph
length, came in from wider of the crease, at 139kph, and he did well to adjust to the late movement away off the seam after pitching on off, to defend
length, outside off, coming back in, and he defends this from the crease
length, outside off, 145kph, and he plays it down towards point from the crease
length, outside off, and he comes forward to meet this 146kph thunderbolt. Looks for a quick single once he defends, but Mendis is having none of it!
fluent drive! Still on a good length, but offered more width this time, and he pressed forward and just eased it through extra cover
length, outside off, and he drives it towards covers
length, outside off, 146kph, and beats his outside edge as he shapes to push it towards cover
length ball, and he plays it with the outer part of the bat, beyond third slip and towards third man
length, outside off, and nipping away further, and beats Mendis as he shapes to defend
full, on the pads, and he swings it away confidently towards midwicket. Bad ball, and gets what it deserved
length ball, outside off, and he leaves this
dug in short, and he ducks into it. Took his eyes off it completely, but it rose enough not to get close to his body, or his raised bat
dug in short, and he ducks into it. Took his eyes off it completely, but it rose enough not to get close to his body, or his raised bat
length ball, and he comes forward to defend it under his eyes
length, comes back into Oshada as he stretches forward and defends it
length, comes back into him, and he defends from the crease after covering the angle
length, outside off, and he punches it towards covers
length, outside off, and he comes forward to meet it
fuller, straighter, and he drives it back towards the bowler, who fields it to his right. This was bowled at 132kph
length, comes back into him from outside off, and he defends
length, but straight, and he plays it down the ground with a straight bat. Just uses his wrists to guide this 143kph ball towards long on, beyond short midwicket
length, outside off, and he leaves. This was bowled at 141kph
fuller, outside off, and he leaves. This was delivered at 143kph
shorter, goes into him, and he does well to keep it down as he flicks it down towards backward square leg. Quick response from the non-striker as he calls for two immediately
dug in short, and he ducks inside it. Well directed, and decent pace at 137kph
length, angles in, shapes away at 141kph, and he leaves
sharp turn, starts from outside off and goes wide. Oshada was getting nowhere near that!
beats the outside edge! Tossed up, he stretches to meet it, and it turns past his outside edge
shorter in length, and he goes back and cuts it back. It's Mulder who tries to keep it in, but it beats his attempt and hits the ropes
tossed up, and he defends. The ball skews away towards forward short leg, but goes after bouncing
tossed up, outside off, and he eases it towards extra cover
presses forward and defends that
banged in short and outside off, run down to deep third man
back of a length and angling into the hips, Mendis sits back, rides the bounce and secures a single to long leg
chest-high short ball on middle, 140kph, Oshada takes it on and hooks a single to long leg. Not middled, but he's not going to back down from the challenge

what a gem from Olivier. He has been bowling such balls for fun this summer. Fuller than a good length, angling in at off, tricks Mendis into playing for the angle but it straightens away late to miss the outside edge and top of off
Olivier now finds the outside edge, but it does not carry to Dean Elgar at second slip
banged in short and outside off, Mendis rocks back and ends up flapping a pull over midwicket
on a length and outside off, 144ks, Oshada does not care. He likes bat on ball. He reaches out and crunches a drive to the right of backward point
short and outside off, Oshada rides the bounce and glides this 142kph dart through the gap at point
back of a length and outside off, Oshada loosens his grip and runs a single through point
short and holds its line outside off, ignored
full and outside off, Kusal throws his bat at ball and carves it over backward point
on a length and holds its line outside off, left alone
full and angling in at off, defended back to the bowler
on a length and slanted in at off, blocked back to the bowler
full and slanted in at off, 140ks, played back to the bowler off the front foot
full and hung up outside off, Oshada chases a big drive and... misses
length ball around off, defended back
back of a length and slanted in at the pads, deflected away through square leg
full and nips away outside off, 148kph, beats the outside edge
back of a length and angling into the hips, picked away through square leg off the back foot
Mendis rides the bounce of this short ball outside off and steers it behind Bavuma at point
short and slanted in at 148kph, Oshada presses forward and defends resolutely
much fuller and faster at 149kph, Oshada aims a leg-side flick but ends up scooping it back off a gentle leading edge
banged in short and angling in at 149kph again, Oshada camps back and keeps it out
shorter and outside off, run away to backward point off the back foot
good length and angling in at off, Mendis gets behind the line and defensively drops the ball to cover
back of a length and outside off, jabbed on the bounce to gully, where Bavuma makes a tumbling save to his left
pitched further up at off, 138ks, Oshada tips forward and drives the ball straight of mid-off. Lovely timing from Oshada but the ball plugs in the outfield
lifter outside off, Mendis ventures a ramp, but can't touch it as the ball flies through to De Kock
banged in short at off, diffused to cover off the back foot
bouncer outside off, Oshada goes for a hook, despite the presence of two men in the deep on the leg side, and misses
good length and outside off, blocked to cover off the front foot
back of a length and holds its line outside off, Oshada shoulders arms
short and outside off, swatted away to the left of deep midwicket off the back foot
proper bouncer outside off, 143ks, Oshada shelves the hook and ignores it this time
full on middle, driven to mid-on off the front foot
shortish and outside off, jabbed on the bounce to gully
nice and full on off, pressed to short cover
full and angling in from wide of the crease, Mendis checks his drive and chips it right over Oshada's head for four. This boundary brings up the fifty stand between these two
short and outside off, Mendis plays away from the body and stabs the ball away to gully

dug in short on middle, Mendis picks up the length in a flash. He skips back, goes deep in the crease, and middles a pull to the left of long leg for four. Rabada dives in vain in the outfield. Dimuth applauds that shot from the change room
lifter outside off, 142ks, flies through to the keeper as Mendis hunkers down
back of a length and holds its line outside off, no shot
mighty full on middle and leg, overpitched, Oshada stretches out, sizes it up and unfurls a jabbing drive over his partner's head
short and angling in at off, fended off to the leg side
short at the chest, fended away to the leg side. This was speared at 148kph

There's history! Sri Lanka becomes the first subcontinent side to win a Test series in South Africa. What a moment! This is well tossed up, he turns this wide of midwicket to clinch the winning runs. What a performance. Sri Lanka arrived here battered and bruised. Walloped in Australia, bruised by injuries to key players, captain dropped, new skipper instated, only spinner gets injured, and here they are, with a 2-0 series win. Well played, Sri Lanka.
